required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Metformin on Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Metformin and Beyond: Individualizing Care for Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the current study is to determine the effects of metformin in non-diabetic patients with low back pain, and identify novel targets for future treatments

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Numeric Pain Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 10 with a higher score indicating more severe pain

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Oswestry Disability Index
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0% to 100% with higher percentage scores indicating greater disability

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale 25
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 100 in which a higher score demonstrates greater resilience

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in 10 Meter Walk Test
secondary_outcome.description: Subject is timed walking at normal speed and also fastest speed possible. A faster time is associated with better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Fear Avoidance Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 96 in which a higher score indicates greater fear avoidance beliefs

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Godin Leisure Time Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum score is 0 and there is no maximum score. A higher score indicates a more active individual.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Catastrophizing Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Score range from 0 to 36 with a higher score indicating a higher degree of catastrophizing

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 21 with a higher score indicating more anxiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in PROMIS (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System) 16 Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: This questionnaire is scored on the T-score metric. A higher score indicates a greater amount of whatever concept that the question asks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient Health Questionnaire-9
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 27 with higher scores indicating more depressive symptoms
Scores range from 5 to 25 with higher scores indicating more problems. Scores on the visual analogue scale range from 0 to 100 with 100 being the best

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in McGill Pain Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 45 with a higher score indicating more pain.

arm_group.description: High Dose Metformin Group (n=100). Subjects will receive metformin and will be instructed to take 2 tabs per day (1,000mg) for the first week then increase to 3 tabs per day (1,500mg) for the remaining 6 months.

Low Dose Metformin Group (n=100). Subjects will receive metformin and will be instructed to take 2 tabs per day (1 metformin tab (500mg) and 1 placebo tab in pre-packaged blister pack) for the first week then increase to 3 tabs per day (1 metformin tab (500mg) and 2 placebo tabs (in pre-packaged blister pack) for the remaining 6 months.
Placebo Group (n=100). Subjects will receive placebo and will be instructed to take 2 tabs per day for the first week then increase to 3 tabs per day for the remaining 6 months.

Control Group (n=100). Subjects will be told that they are in the wait-list control group. They will have a 3 month "waiting period" before they will be randomized again to a treatment group. They will be randomized to one of the previous groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 and above
- Diagnosed with axial low back pain (low back pain more severe than pain in other parts of the body, without radiation of pain into the lower extremities).
- Women of child bearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test at baseline.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, other autoimmune/systemic inflammatory arthropathies
- Progressive lower extremity weakness or numbness
- Recent oral steroid use (within last 3 months)
- NSAID use
- Chronic kidney disease (eGFR <60)
- Diagnosis of diabetes mellitus
- Subjects must not be pregnant or breastfeeding, or planning to become pregnant or breastfeed during the course of the trial
- Unable to take an oral medication in a non crushable pill form
- Taking metformin presently or within the last 6 months
- History of allergy to metformin
- History of lactic acidosis
- Severe Hepatic dysfunction
- Currently taking a diabetic medication such as sitagliptin, saxagliptin, linagliptin, alogliptin, sitagliptin with metformin
- Currently taking a Carbonic anhydrase inhibitor such as topiramate, zonisamide, acetazolamide, dichlorphenamide, methazolamide
- Currently taking cimetidine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor and Chair Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation
